subject: Stadiums and Arenas
Hurricane Katrina
Football
lead_paragraph: When the state and the New Orleans Saints renew negotiations about a new, long-term agreement to keep the team in Louisiana, a new stadium will probably not be on the table for at least five years, Gov. Kathleen Blanco said yesterday. Blanco said the state invested significant dollars in substantial upgrades to the Louisiana Superdome, the Saints’ home, after Hurricane Katrina. She said she expected that “down the line” the Saints might get a new stadium, but not in the next five years. In previous negotiations to extend the state’s financial deal with the team beyond 2010, the team owner, Tom Benson, had pressed for a new stadium, but that was before Katrina hit in August 2005.
